clinical_study.brief_title: Three Types of Nucleotide/Nucleoside Analogues Treatment in HBV Related ACLF
clinical_study.official_title: Study on Three Types of Nucleotide/Nucleoside Analogues Treatment in Patients With Hepatitis b Virus Related Acute-on-chronic Liver Failure

lead_sponsor.agency: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

clinical_study.source: Third Affiliated Hospital, Sun Yat-Sen University

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to investigate the clinical efficacy of three types of nucleotide/nucleoside analogues in treatment of HBV-related acute-on-chronic liver failure.

detailed_description.textblock: Hepatitis b virus (HBV) related acute-on-chronic liver failure (ACLF) is a serious condition with high mortality rate in China. Nucleotide/nucleoside analogues are used for anti-virus treatment in these patients. Entecavir, Tenofovir Disoproxil Fumarate and Tenofovir Alafenamide are first line drug in China. But there still lacks of data of Tenofovir Alafenamide in treatment of HBV related ACLF. This study is to investigate the clinical efficacy of three types of nucleotide/nucleoside analogues in treatment of HBV related ACLF.

primary_outcome.description: Whether patients will survive after treatment is observed in the follow-up.

secondary_outcome.measure: Model for end-stage liver disease (MELD) score is recorded after treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0 week, 4 week, 8 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week,144 week
secondary_outcome.description: The calculation of model for end-stage liver disease (MELD) score is: R=0.378ln[serum total bilirubin (mg/dl)]+1.12ln(prothrombin time international normalized ratio)+0.95ln[serum creatinin(mg/dl)]+0.64. The higher the MELD score, the higher the mortality rate. MELD score is recorded after treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Ratio of patients with undetectable hepatitis b virus DNA after treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 4 week, 8 week, 12 week, 24 week, 48 week, 72 week,144 week
secondary_outcome.description: Hepatitis b virus DNA would be tested to know the ratio of patients with undetectable hepatitis b virus DNA at 7 time points after treatment.

arm_group.description: 50 patients would receive treatment of oral entecavir (ETV) 0.5 mg once per day from baseline to life-long.
50 patients would receive treatment of oral tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) 300 mg once per day from baseline to life-long.
50 patients would receive treatment of oral tenofovir alafenamide (TAF) 25 mg once per day from baseline to life-long.

intervention.description: Patients would receive treatment of oral entecavir (ETV) 0.5 mg once per day.
Patients would receive treatment of oral tenofovir disoproxil fumarate (TDF) 300 mg once per day.
Patients would receive treatment of oral tenofovir alafenamide (TAF) 25 mg once per day.
